content:
• Friday, November 30, 2012
  • ETN

    Cooper Industries (CBE) gains in the post session after Eaton (NYSE:ETN) announces its...

    Cooper Industries (CBE) gains in the post session after Eaton (NYSE:ETN) announces its acquisition of CBE is completed. The deal was announced on May 21, 2012 and combines Eaton and Cooper into a new, premier global power management company named Eaton Corporation plc.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM
  • NTLS

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NTLS +25.2%. GAI +10.2%. CBE +5.8%. GEO +5.4%. SYRG...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NTLS +25.2%. GAI +10.2%. CBE +5.8%. GEO +5.4%. SYRG +2.8%. 
    After-hours top losers: SCMP -8.4%. CDXS -3.3%. JRCC -2.9%. BKW -2.8%. GFIG -2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • HF

    HFF (NYSE:HF) declares special dividend of $1.52/share. For shareholders of record Dec 10....

    HFF (NYSE:HF) declares special dividend of $1.52/share. For shareholders of record Dec 10. Payable Dec 20. Ex-div date Dec 06. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • GEO

    The GEO Group (NYSE:GEO) announced special dividend of $340M-$360M, subject to approval by...

    The GEO Group (NYSE:GEO) announced special dividend of $340M-$360M, subject to approval by Board. The record date for potential dividend is Dec 12. The board meeting will be held on on before Dec 07. The potential special dividend would be paid if GEO elects to convert into a real estate investment trust. Shares +5.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • DUK

    Investors approved of the proposed settlement with the N.C. Utilities Commission that...

    Investors approved of the proposed settlement with the N.C. Utilities Commission that effectively forces Jim Rogers out of any leadership role at Duke Energy (DUK +2.3%). The regulators clearly were out to get Rogers; adding insult to injury, the CEO search committee and DUK’s board are not permitted to appoint anyone who has served as DUK’s CEO, chairman or president - the titles Rogers holds.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 9 Comments
  • CEO

    Nexen (NXY +4%) shares power higher after a Canadian cabinet figure known to have reservations...

    Nexen (NXY +4%) shares power higher after a Canadian cabinet figure known to have reservations about Cnooc's (CEO +1.1%) bid to buy the energy producer says at least some of the government's concerns about getting reciprocal treatment from China had been addressed by an investment pact.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE +2.1%) is higher on a day when Siemens (SI) announced it plans to cut 4,700 jobs at...

    Cree (CREE +2.1%) is higher on a day when Siemens (SI) announced it plans to cut 4,700 jobs at its Osram lighting unit, which competes with Cree in LED lighting, ahead of a spinoff. Though many of the cuts involve factories making traditional lighting products, a Reuters column noted Osram could try to boost profitability by procuring LED chips from third-parties. If Osram went in that direction, Cree would be a potential supplier. LED equipment firms Veeco (VECO -3.7%) and GT Advanced (GTAT -2.6%) are off today.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • CNX

    Two employees are injured another remains missing after an earthen dam collapses at Consol...

    Two employees are injured another remains missing after an earthen dam collapses at Consol Energy's (CNX -2.3%) Robinson Run Mine in West Virginia.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • SPLK

    Splunk (SPLK +1.5%) bounces back from early morning weakness after CEO Godfrey R. Sullivan says...

    Splunk (SPLK +1.5%) bounces back from early morning weakness after CEO Godfrey R. Sullivan says his company isn't in any discussions regarding takeovers. Its Q3 report beat targets yesterday, but the results exposed higher costs for the IT data cruncher. Needham still rates the shares a Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • SIGA

    SIGA Technologies (SIGA +4.7%) is up strongly after announcing it has received a $12.3M...

    SIGA Technologies (SIGA +4.7%) is up strongly after announcing it has received a $12.3M milestone payment from the U.S. government related to a national stockpile contract for its smallpox drug. The company also announced the drug, formerly known as ST-246, will now be called Arestvyr. The stockpile contract has been a source of controversy.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • SID

    Brazilian steelmaker CSN (SID -6.6%) is offering to buy ThyssenKrupp's plants in the Americas...

    Brazilian steelmaker CSN (SID -6.6%) is offering to buy ThyssenKrupp's plants in the Americas for ~$3B, Bloomberg reports. ThyssenKrupp announced in May that a sale of its U.S. and Brazilian plants is among strategic options amid rising building costs and project delays.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • CVM

    Cel-Sci (CVM +3.5%) has rallied after issuing a shareholder letter in which the company...

    Cel-Sci (CVM +3.5%) has rallied after issuing a shareholder letter in which the company expressed confidence about the outlook for Phase III trials of its Multikine immunotherapy treatment for head and neck cancer. The company also said it plans to increase the number of patient recruitment centers for the trials to at least 50, comapred with a current 36.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 3 Comments
  • ALIM

    Alimera Sciences (ALIM -14%) takes a hit today after the UK's National Institute for Health and...

    Alimera Sciences (ALIM -14%) takes a hit today after the UK's National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence issued final draft guidance indicating that Iluvien is not recommended for the treatment of chronic diabetic macular edema. The agency noted the drug was insufficiently responsive to available therapies, and that that cost-effectiveness thresholds weren't met.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • BCRX

    BioCryst (BCRX +7.5%) is up after terminating its merger agreement with private Presidio...

    BioCryst (BCRX +7.5%) is up after terminating its merger agreement with private Presidio Pharmaceuticals, which was contingent on BioCryst securing $60M in financing. However, shares are well off their morning highs. BioCryst had agreed to buy Presidio in an all-stock deal once valued at $101M, but its shares had been cut in more than half since then thanks to a withdrawn application for a hepatitis drug, and the ending of trials for a flu drug. SA's PropThink expects BioCryst to remain on the hunt for fresh capital.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • MITL

    Mitel (MITL +32.4%) is recouping a big chunk of the losses it saw following its Aug. 8 warning...

    Mitel (MITL +32.4%) is recouping a big chunk of the losses it saw following its Aug. 8 warning after beating FQ2 estimates and guiding for FQ3 revenue of $141M-$146M, in-line with a $142.1M consensus. The maker of unified communications gear, which has had trouble competing against bigger vendors such as Cisco, reported a 100% Y/Y increase in the size of cloud product customer base. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy's (WLT +7.3) refusal to comment on rumors of BHP's interest in an acquisition...

    Walter Energy's (WLT +7.3) refusal to comment on rumors of BHP's interest in an acquisition keeps shares moving higher, perhaps suggesting more than idle chatter. Also, another analyst sees the coal industry improving in 2013. The two developments are propping up the sector (KOL +0.5): JRCC +7.6%, OXF +4.2%, ANR +3.4%, ACI +2%, BTU +0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • TSLA

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA +0.1%) skip lower with word that Value Investors Club issued a...

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA +0.1%) skip lower with word that Value Investors Club issued a short report on the EV automaker.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • MARK

    Midday top 10 gainers: MARK +38%. MITL +30%. MHH +25%. CBK +24%. PPHM +24%. AMPL +24%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: MARK +38%. MITL +30%. MHH +25%. CBK +24%. PPHM +24%. AMPL +24%. OTCQB:TELK +19%. PLNR +17%. TLAB +15%. FIVE +15%.
    Top 10 Losers: RIC -24%. NTLS -23%. FFKY -19%. SUPN -18%. SBLK -14%. VRSN -14%. PSUN -14%. MMYT -13%. HGSH -13%. PWX -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS +3%), Leap Wireless (LEAP +4.3%), and Clearwire (CLWR +8.1%) are higher after a...

    MetroPCS (PCS +3%), Leap Wireless (LEAP +4.3%), and Clearwire (CLWR +8.1%) are higher after a Guggenheim Securities analyst writes Sprint (S -0.6%) could make a $12-$13/share bid for MetroPCS in the next 4 weeks. Speculation debt-laden Sprint will try to grab MetroPCS from T-Mobile has been around for a while, aided by the fact SoftBank's (OTCPK:SFTBF) CEO has said he won't rule out an offer. Also: Chat on the Street has passed on a (somewhat questionable) rumor Carlos Slim is talking with Clearwire.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • MNI

    McClatchy (MNI -1.2%) dips today after Moody's cut its outlook on the newspaper publisher to...

    McClatchy (MNI -1.2%) dips today after Moody's cut its outlook on the newspaper publisher to stable from positive, citing expectations that ongoing revenue pressure on newspapers will make it difficult for the company to reduce its high leverage. The downgrade affects around $1.6B worth of the company's debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • MNK

    More on Questcor (QCOR -6.4%): Aetna's (AET +0.3%) latest bulletin shows no change from its...

    More on Questcor (QCOR -6.4%): Aetna's (AET +0.3%) latest bulletin shows no change from its position first taken in September on Acthar. The insurer is still limiting reimbursement of the drug only for the treatment of infantile spasms. AET asserts that the drug's other approved uses are medically unnecessary or unproven.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • DRWI

    DragonWave (DRWI +17.1%) is roaring today. The company announced this morning it has closed the...

    DragonWave (DRWI +17.1%) is roaring today. The company announced this morning it has closed the acquisition of the Chinese portion of Nokia Siemens' mobile backhaul equipment business, but it had already finished acquiring the rest of the business earlier this year. DragonWave had a short ratio of 9.7 as of Nov. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • GTIV

    Gentiva Health Services (GTIV -2%) slips today, despite its announcement late yesterday that the...

    Gentiva Health Services (GTIV -2%) slips today, despite its announcement late yesterday that the SEC had completed its investigation into the company's participation in the Medicare Home Health Prospective Payment System and doesn't intend to recommend any enforcement action. The investigation was primarily focused on the number of therapy visits and reimbursements GTIV received before and after changes in the Medicare reimbursement system, as well as the company's relationships with physicians.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR -2.8%) slides on news it won’t need as many drilling rigs as planned in an...

    Petrobras (PBR -2.8%) slides on news it won’t need as many drilling rigs as planned in an important deepwater project, inciting worries the purchase will detract from spending on existing projects. But Simmons analysts say the move is positive overall because PBR is "showing some restraint on capex and that well productivity has been better than they may have originally planned."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 2 Comments
  • ZUMZ

    Shares of Zumiez (ZUMZ -6%) carve out a 52-week low after the mall retailer turns in a below par...

    Shares of Zumiez (ZUMZ -6%) carve out a 52-week low after the mall retailer turns in a below par Q3 report. Though the effect of Hurricane Sandy and soft sales in Europe are concerns, demand trends in general look weak for the company's products.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +1.4%) gains on the back of yesterday's $1B buyback announcement and an...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +1.4%) gains on the back of yesterday's $1B buyback announcement and an upgrade to Buy at Mizuho. The firm says that concerns about a Durata recall are overblown, and that any impact on its EPS from market share loss in implanted defibrillators should be "more than offset" by yesterday's buyback announcement.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • ULTA

    Shares of Ulta Salon (ULTA +7.4%) jump higher on the back of an upgrade from Wells Fargo to...

    Shares of Ulta Salon (ULTA +7.4%) jump higher on the back of an upgrade from Wells Fargo to Outperform. The retailer also was mentioned on Mad Money as a domestic growth story.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 2 Comments
  • EXEL

    Shares of Exelixis (EXEL -6.4%) are trading lower today following yesterday's post-session...

    Shares of Exelixis (EXEL -6.4%) are trading lower today following yesterday's post-session trading halt, despite receiving approval from both the FDA and the European Medicines Agency for cabozantinib, a treatment for a rare type of thyroid cancer. Part of the reason for the dip can possibly be attributed to the lack of information on the drug going into the decision, plus skittishness following an unexplained cancellation of the FDA's vote on cabozantinib's NDA earlier this month.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • YOKU

    Youku Tudou (YOKU +9.9%) opened lower, but is now up strongly in response to its Q3 report....

    Youku Tudou (YOKU +9.9%) opened lower, but is now up strongly in response to its Q3 report. Though EPS missed estimates, revenue was ahead of forecasts even if one backs out $3M provided by Tudou following the Aug. 23 merger closing. For Q4, the company is forecasting revenue of RMB610M-RMB630M ($97.7M-$101.8M); between them, Youku and Tudou reported revenue of $75.6M in Q4 2012. Q3 content costs were $29M (36% of revenue), and bandwidth costs $21.7M (27%) .

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 3 Comments
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (WLT +4.4%) shares surge in early trading as renewed chatter of takeover interest...

    Walter Energy (WLT +4.4%) shares surge in early trading as renewed chatter of takeover interest from BHP Billiton (NYSE:BHP) makes the rounds. WLT was the subject of rumored interest from the likes of BHP, Rio Tinto and others late last year (I, II).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • NTLS

    Regional mobile carrier NTELOS (NTLS -21.8%) has crashed after FBR says it believes Sprint...

    Regional mobile carrier NTELOS (NTLS -21.8%) has crashed after FBR says it believes Sprint (NYSE:S) will end its wholesale deal, with an announcement set for FY13 (ends in March). FBR, which is downgrading shares to Underperform and lowering its PT to $5 from $15, notes the Sprint deal accounted for 32.4% of NTELOS' 2011 wireless revenue, and 57.4% of its adjusted EBITDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 5 Comments
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR -6.1%) after Mizuho starts the stock off with a Neutral rating...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR -6.1%) after Mizuho starts the stock off with a Neutral rating and $28 price target. There's also word Aetna is fixing to slash more coverage of Questcor's Acthar.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 6 Comments
  • PDCE

    PDC Energy (PDCE +3.9%) pops higher at the open after SunTrust recommends buying shares ahead of...

    PDC Energy (PDCE +3.9%) pops higher at the open after SunTrust recommends buying shares ahead of Utica test results, expecting positive production rates as well as a boost from Noble Energy's (NYSE:NBL) analyst day on Dec. 6. The firm rates PDC Energy a Buy with a $43 price target, up from $37.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD +6.1%) is planning to launch a solid-state drive (SSD) line based on its Radeon...

    AMD (AMD +6.1%) is planning to launch a solid-state drive (SSD) line based on its Radeon GPU brand, SemiAccurate reports. While AMD would have the brand power and OEM/channel relationships needed to make a dent, it would also be entering a very competitive market featuring many players (SanDisk, Samsung, Micron, Intel, Toshiba) who can source NAND flash memory at cost. But this might be a good time for the struggling chipmaker to try expanding into a growth market.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM | 3 Comments
  • ACTV

    Active Network (NYSE:ACTV) +6.9% on a two-notch upgrade to Buy from BofA/Merrill. Shares of the...

    Active Network (NYSE:ACTV) +6.9% on a two-notch upgrade to Buy from BofA/Merrill. Shares of the the event-management site were crushed in October after it issued poor Q4 and 2013 guidance, and were down 61% YTD going into today. 8.5% of Active's float was shorted as of Nov. 15.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • SBLK

    Star Bulk Carriers (NASDAQ:SBLK): Q3 EPS of -$0.70 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $18.4M beats by...

    Star Bulk Carriers (NASDAQ:SBLK): Q3 EPS of -$0.70 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $18.4M beats by $0.7M. Shares -11.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • AXAS

    Abraxas Petroleum (NASDAQ:AXAS) +3.1% premarket after providing production guidance of...

    Abraxas Petroleum (NASDAQ:AXAS) +3.1% premarket after providing production guidance of 4,300-4,500 boe/day on average for Q4 and 4,900-5,200 boe/day for 2013 (21%-28% growth over 2012). AXAS also says it is actively marketing "numerous" non-core assets; an activist investor sent a letter earlier this week requesting asset sales and other steps to improve shareholder value.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) -4% on disappointment the board plans to keep Andrew Mason as CEO for now....

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) -4% on disappointment the board plans to keep Andrew Mason as CEO for now. The drop comes even though Evercore's Ken Sena, a long-time bear, has become slightly less bearish, raising his PT to $3 from $2 on a belief Groupon Goods e-commerce sales will grow to $2.5B in 2013 from $1B in 2012, mostly offsetting a big drop in daily deals sales to $2.6B from $4.2B. Sena notes Groupon has ~40M active customer accounts to push Goods offers to, and that its Goods revenue/active user is still well below that of peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • IOC

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) +2.5% premarket after announcing better than expected results from its...

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) +2.5% premarket after announcing better than expected results from its Antelope-3 appraisal well in Papua New Guinea. The well has penetrated the top of the reservoir at 5,328 ft. measured depth, 217 ft. above the predrill estimate and 92 ft. higher than the Antelope-1 well.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 4 Comments
  • VRSN

    More on VeriSign: The company announces the Department of Commerce has approved a 6-year renewal...

    More on VeriSign: The company announces the Department of Commerce has approved a 6-year renewal of its deal to operate the .com domain name registry. VeriSign's current fee of $7.85/registration will continue, but it won't be able to implement four 7% price hikes over the course of the renewal deal, as it had planned. Instead, price hikes will be tied to a new "consensus policy" or "extraordinary expenses," and will require the DoC's approval. VRSN -14.8%. CC at 8:30AM ET (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 AM
  • EBR

    Electrobras (NYSE:EBR) +22.2% premarket after Brazil's government offers an additional 9.87B...

    Electrobras (NYSE:EBR) +22.2% premarket after Brazil's government offers an additional 9.87B reais ($4.7B) to utilities that accept Pres. Rousseff’s plan to renew electricity license with lower rates, on top of 20.04B reais announced Nov. 1. EBR preferred shares lead the Bovespa index, up 28%. ELP +4.1%, CIG +2.6%, CPL +1.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • TLAB

    Tellabs (NASDAQ:TLAB) +15.3% after declaring a $1/share special dividend and naming interim...

    Tellabs (NASDAQ:TLAB) +15.3% after declaring a $1/share special dividend and naming interim chief Dan Kelly its permanent CEO. The telecom equipment vendor, which has long been bleeding share due to its exposure to legacy technologies such as SONET/SDH, closed yesterday not too far away from 16-year lows. Some may be hoping Kelly's R&D background will help Tellabs improve its competitive footing.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:46 AM
  • SUPN

    Supernus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SUPN) dives 16% after pricing a 6M secondary at just $8/share....

    Supernus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SUPN) dives 16% after pricing a 6M secondary at just $8/share. The stock was trading at $11 late yesterday afternoon. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 AM
  • YUM

    More reaction to Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM): The announcement that sales could slip in China for the...

    More reaction to Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM): The announcement that sales could slip in China for the first time since Q4 of 2009 is "very surprising" to analysts expecting the growth train to roar on. Raymond James doesn't mince words, saying the drop off in China traffic creates "significant visibility issues" for profits. Shares of YUM are stumbling, -9.7% premarket to $67.28.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM
  • FB

    Backing up past remarks from execs, Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) says it isn't planning to develop its...

    Backing up past remarks from execs, Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) says it isn't planning to develop its own games, even if its amended deal with Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) will soon allow it to. Nonetheless, many think amendment provisions that subject Zynga to "Facebook's standard terms of service" will put an end to its special relationship with the social networking giant. "Facebook is moving toward treating all developers as equal," says the CEO of Zynga rival/lawsuit target Kixeye. ZNGA -7.6%. FB +0.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM
  • WWAV

    WhiteWave Foods (NYSE:WWAV): Q3 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $575M (+13% Y/Y)...

    WhiteWave Foods (NYSE:WWAV): Q3 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $575M (+13% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 AM
  • YUM

    Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) starts to fall out of favor with analysts after the company lowered its...

    Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) starts to fall out of favor with analysts after the company lowered its profit expectations for 2013. Susquehanna downgrades the restaurant operator to Neutral from Positive, while Deutsche Bank clipped its price target to $66 and lowered EPS estimates. YUM -9.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:33 AM
  • TEVA

    Teva Pharmaceutical (NYSE:TEVA) forecasts 2013 EPS of $4.85-$5.15 against Street expectations...

    Teva Pharmaceutical (NYSE:TEVA) forecasts 2013 EPS of $4.85-$5.15 against Street expectations for $5.63. Total revenue is expected at $19.5B-$20.5B. Shares -5.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:09 AM | 2 Comments
